gw.api.database

Class IQueryResult<QT extends Bean,RT extends Object>

  • gw.api.database.IQueryResult<QT,RT>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IQueryResultSet<T>, Iterable<T>

    public class IQueryResult<QT extends Bean,RT extends Object>
implements IQueryResultSet<T>, Iterable<T>
    A QueryProcessor represents a result from a database query. QueryProcessor objects are materialized from a Query object. The Query is strictly a server side entity, so this implies that query results can only be materialized on in the server.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean Capped
      true if the search results had to be capped.
      int Count
      Returns the approximate count of entities in the results.

      WARNING: This executes a count(*) query so it is neither cheap nor atomic. Thus when the results are counted and then subsequently retrieved, the number of results may actually be different from the number returned by the iterator. Nevertheless calling this method can be cheaper than iterating over lots of entities (which are loaded into memory) and maintaining a count to test whether or not to proceed with the iteration.
      boolean Empty
      Returns true if and only if this query processor does not have any results. Note that this method executes the query, so for performance reasons it should not be followed by calls to any other methods of this interface that attempt to count the number of query results or that attempt to get one or more of the results themselves.
      Object FirstResult
      Returns this processor's first result if it has one. Otherwise returns null. This method has the side effect of setting the chunking processor.
      Object OnlyResult

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.guidewire.commons.system.database.SortColumn addAscendingSortColumn(String strColumnPath)
      Adds the sort columns to the query. Arbitrarily long bean paths can be specified even if the results are benas.
      com.guidewire.commons.system.database.SortColumn addDescendingSortColumn(String strColumnPath)
      Adds the sort columns to the query. Arbitrarily long bean paths can be specified even if the results are benas.
      void addFilter(com.guidewire.commons.metadata.types.IQueryFilter filter)
      Adds a filter to this query. If the filter is null, this is treated like a no-op.
      boolean allMatch(block(elt1:RT):boolean cond)
      Returns true if all elements in this collection match the given condition and false otherwise
      MonetaryAmount average(block(elt:RT):MonetaryAmount select)
      Return the average of the values of the target of the mapper argument, which must all be of the default currency. Delete this method if you are running Multi-Currency mode!
      MonetaryAmount average(Currency currency, block(elt:RT):MonetaryAmount select)
      Return the average of the values of the target of the mapper argument, which must all be of the same currency as specified.
      BigDecimal average(block(elt:RT):Number select)
      Return the average of the mapped value
      void clearFilters()
      Clears all filters on this query.
      void clearSortColumns()
      Clears all sort columns that have been added
      Collection<RT> concat(Collection<RT> that)
      Return a new list that is the concatenation of the two lists
      int countWhere(block(elt:RT):boolean cond)
      Return the count of elements in this collection that match the given condition
      Set<RT> disjunction(Collection<RT> that)
      Returns a the set disjunction of this collection and the other collection, that is, all elements that are in one collection *not* and not the other.
      void each(block(elt:RT):void operation)
      This method will invoke the operation on each element in the Collection
      void eachWithIndex(block(elt:RT, index:int):void operation)
      This method will invoke the operation on each element in the Collection, passing in the index as well as the element
      RT first()
      Returns the first element in this collection. If the collection is empty, null is returned.
      RT firstWhere(block(elt:RT):boolean cond)
      Returns the first element in this collection that matches the given condition. If no element matches the criteria, null is returned.
      List<R> flatMap(block(elt:RT):Collection mapper)
      RT fold(block(elt1:RT, elt2:RT):RT aggregator)
      Returns all the values of this collection folded into a single value
      Object getAtMostOneRow()
      Returns this processor's first result if it has one. Otherwise returns null. Throws an exception if this processor contains multiple results.

      This method has the side effect of setting the chunking processor.
      int getCountLimitedBy(int limit)
      Returns the number of entities in the results limited by the given integer result. This is not cheap but may, on some databases, be a little cheaper than calling getCount() > limit, because specifying the limit allows the database to stop processing rows once the number of rows exceeds the given limit.
      boolean hasMatch(block(elt1:RT):boolean cond)
      Returns true if any elements in this collection match the given condition and false otherwise
      Set<RT> intersect(Collection<RT> that)
      Return the set intersection of these two collections.
      Iterator<Object> iterator(int startRow)
      Returns an iterator of beans for the results of this query starting at startRow. For example, If the startRow value is 1, the next record will be the second row. If the startRow value is negative, it will be ignored
      String join(String delimiter)
      Coerces each element in the collecion to a string and joins them together with the given delimiter
      RT last()
      Returns the last element in this collection. If the collection is empty, null is returned.
      RT lastWhere(block(elt:RT):boolean cond)
      Returns the last element in this collection that matches the given condition. If the collection is empty, null is returned.
      List<Q> map(block(elt:RT):Q mapper)
      Maps the values of the collection to a list of values by calling the mapper block on each element.
      R max(block(elt:RT):R transform)
      Returns the maximum value of the transformed elements.
      RT maxBy(block(elt:RT):Comparable
      R min(block(elt:RT):R transform)
      Returns the minimum value of the transformed elements.
      RT minBy(block(elt:RT):Comparable
      IQueryResult<Bean,Object> orderBy(IEntityPropertyInfo column)
      Orders by column in ascending order.

      This clears all other order by statements. See thenBy to add incremental columns.
      IQueryResult<QT,RT> orderBy(block(row:QT):Object column)
      IQueryResult<Bean,Object> orderByDescending(IEntityPropertyInfo column)
      Orders by column in descending order.

      This clears all other order by statements. See thenBy to add incremental columns.
      IQueryResult<QT,RT> orderByDescending(block(row:QT):Object column)
      Map<Q,RT> partitionUniquely(block(elt:RT):Q mapper)
      Partitions each element into a Map where the keys are the value produce by the mapper block and the values are the elements of the Collection. If two elements map to the same key an IllegalStateException is thrown.
      V reduce(V init, block(val:V, elt2:RT):V aggregator)
      Returns all the values of this collection down to a single value
      void removeWhere(block(elt:RT):boolean cond)
      Removes all elements that match the given condition in this collection
      void retainWhere(block(elt:RT):boolean cond)
      Retains all elements that match the given condition in this collection
      List<RT> reverse()
      Returns a new list of the elements in the collection, in their reverse iteration order
      void setPageSize(int iRows)
      Sets the page size in terms of the number of rows per page. Rows in the results are fetched a page at a time when rows are iterated.

      A number less than or equal to zero indicates all rows are returned in a single page. This is typically not an advisable setting.
      RT single()
      Returns a single element from this iterable, if only one exists. It no elements are in this iterable, or if there are more than one elements in it, an IllegalStateException is thrown
      RT singleWhere(block(elt:RT):boolean cond)
      Returns a single item matching the given condition. If there is no such element or if multiple elements match the condition, and IllegalStateException is thrown.
      Set<RT> subtract(Collection<RT> that)
      Returns the Set subtraction of that Collection from this Collection
      MonetaryAmount sum(block(elt:RT):MonetaryAmount mapper)
      Sums up the values of the target of the mapper argument, which must all be of the default currency. Delete this method if you are running Multi-Currency mode!
      MonetaryAmount sum(Currency currency, block(elt:RT):MonetaryAmount mapper)
      Sums up the values of the target of the mapper argument, which must all be of the same currency as specified.

      Sums up the values of the target of the mapper argument

      int sum(block(elt:RT):Short mapper)
      Sums up the values of the target of the mapper argument
      CurrencyAmount sum(block(elt:RT):CurrencyAmount mapper)
      Sums up the values of the target of the mapper argument. Returns null if the array is empty, since the currency cannot be determined. Note: this behavior is different from that of other sum methods, where zero is returned.
      IQueryResult<Bean,Object> thenBy(IEntityPropertyInfo column)
      Orders by column in ascending order.

      If this Iterable is already a Collection, return this Itearble cast to a Collection. Otherwise create a new Collection and copy this Iterable into it.

      If this Iterable is already a List, return this Iterable cast to a List. Otherwise create a new List and copy this Iterable into it.
      Set<RT> toSet()
      If this Iterable is already a Set, return this Iterable cast to a Set. Otherwise create a new Set based on this Iterable.
      Object[] toTypedArray()
      Returns a strongly-typed array of this Iterable, as opposed to the argumentless Iterable#toArray(), which returns an Object array. This method takes advantage of static reification and, therefore, does not necessarily return an array that matches the theoretical runtime type of the Iterable, if actual reification were supported.

    • Field Detail

      • Count

        int Count
        Returns the approximate count of entities in the results.

        WARNING: This executes a count(*) query so it is neither cheap nor atomic. Thus when the results are counted and then subsequently retrieved, the number of results may actually be different from the number returned by the iterator. Nevertheless calling this method can be cheaper than iterating over lots of entities (which are loaded into memory) and maintaining a count to test whether or not to proceed with the iteration.

      • Capped

        boolean Capped
        true if the search results had to be capped.

      • Empty

        boolean Empty
        Returns true if and only if this query processor does not have any results. Note that this method executes the query, so for performance reasons it should not be followed by calls to any other methods of this interface that attempt to count the number of query results or that attempt to get one or more of the results themselves.

      • FirstResult

        Object FirstResult
        Returns this processor's first result if it has one. Otherwise returns null. This method has the side effect of setting the chunking processor.

      • OnlyResult

        Object OnlyResult
